LanguageData.VSE.ExpertiseDesc: Selecting an expertise will unlock a new skill that your pawn will level up, granting them powerful, but very specific bonuses.\nYou can only select {0} expertise, and only in skills your pawns is passionate about.
LanguageData.VSE.ExpertiseAvailableDesc:
Your colonist has reached high enough level in a skill they are passionate about that they can gain expertise.

Consider picking an expertise for them to gain new bonuses to the work type they are good at.

Colonists that can get expertise:
LanguageData.VSE.AllowMultiCritical.Desc: If false, will ensure that only one Critical passion will generate per pawn, to avoid them overlapping and causing them both to be useless.
LanguageData.VSE.CriticalEffectPassions.Desc: If false, the learn rate factor debuff on other skills from Critical will not effect other skills the pawn is passionate about.
LanguageData.VSE.Commonalities: Edit passion commonalities, groups are separate
LanguageData.VSE.AllowExpertiseOverlap.Desc: If false, then only 1 expertise can be chosen per skill, regardless of max expertise setting.
LanguageData.VSE.EnableSkillsLoss.Desc: By default, Ducks' Insane Skills disables all skill loss. By selecting this option, this mod will override Ducks and enable it again. Use this if you still want to be able to take advantage of the forget speed changes in the new passions.
LanguageData.VSE.MinSkillForExpertise: Minimum skill to get an expertise
LanguageData.VSE.MinSkillForExpertiseDesc: The colonist will need to reach this skill level before being offered an expertise.
LanguageData.VSE.StatMultiplierDesc: Is our balance too easy? Too hard? Go bitch on Reddit! Errrr... I mean, change it with this slider! The effects expertise have on stats will be multiplied by this number, so 0.1 will make expertise super weak, while 5 will make them incredibly overpowered.
LanguageData.VSE.GrowthMomentRandomPassions: Random passion chance in growth moments
LanguageData.VSE.GrowthMomentRandomPassionsDesc: By default, 5% of the time a growth moment will select one of the skills that have no passions and assign either a Natural or an Apathy passion.
